story.title: Chicago Public Schools Teacher Tele-Townhall May 17, 2012
story.description: CPS Tele-Townhall Conference Call with the Chicago Public Schools Leadership Team for teachers. Topics included Full (Longer) Day , Common Core implementation, recess, sick days, contract negotiations, and more. Thursday May 17, 2012 5 PM - 6 PM.

author.name: Josh Kalov
author.bio: Fan of education, politics, better government, open source software, sports, & most things peanut butter related.

quote.text: Please join CPS CEO Jean-Claude Brizard and members of his Leadership Team on Thursday, May 17, from 5 to 6 p.m., for another opportunity to ask questions live via phone about issues you care about â from the Full School Day and the new teacher evaluation system to the implementation of the Common Core State Standards, among other topics. Call 1-888-886-6603 and when prompted, punch in 18778 and then the # sign from any phone. Thanks in advance for participating in this call!

meta.message: Please join CPS CEO Jean-Claude Brizard and members of his Leadership Team on Thursday, May 17, from 5 to 6 p.m., for another opportunity to ask questions live via phone about issues you care about â from the Full School Day and the new teacher evaluation system to the implementation of the Common Core State Standards, among other topics. Call 1-888-886-6603 and when prompted, punch in 18778 and then the # sign from any phone. Thanks in advance for participating in this call!

quote.text: RT @ChiPubSchools: Tonight is the, tele-townhall forum for #CPS #teachers with CEO Brizard. Dial 1-888-886-6603 then 18778 then #. http://on.fb.me/KijYMo

user.description: Working to provide a world-class education to every student in every neighborhood. Tweets from CEO Brizard signed -JC. E-mail: twitter@cps.k12.il.us

data.text:
CPS Administration on the call:
Jean-Claude Brizard - Chief Executive Officer
Tim Cawley - Chief Administrative Officer
Alicia Winckler - Chief Talent Officer
Jennifer Cheatham - Chief Instruction Officer

There was also a moderator reading the questions. I did not catch her name.

quote.text: Brizard: $130million increase in discretionary funding for schools. Putting $ where it benefits students #cps

user.description: Fan of education, politics, better government, open source software, sports, & most things peanut butter related.
user.name: Josh Kalov

meta.text: Brizard: $130million increase in discretionary funding for schools. Putting $ where it benefits students #cps

quote.text: @shua123 also cutting lots of positions. Not a net increase of this amount. Schools will have to buy back things they lost.

user.description: Raise Your Hand is a growing coalition of Chicago public schools and organizations associated with or advocating for public education.
user.name: Raise Your Hand

meta.text: @shua123 also cutting lots of positions. Not a net increase of this amount. Schools will have to buy back things they lost.

quote.text: @ilraiseyourhand Do you have specific info/data on what positions are being cut?

user.description: Fan of education, politics, better government, open source software, sports, & most things peanut butter related.
user.name: Josh Kalov

meta.text: @ilraiseyourhand This was just Brizard generally giving examples of how people spend more time practicing/doing activity to improve.

data.text: Brizard was comparing the added school time to how adding time practicing and learning is a key part of improving at all tasks. Football players practice to become better football players. A musician spends time practicing and playing his or her instrument to become a better musician. People that want to become better/faster readers, read more, Writers write more, etc.

quote.text: Brizard- other districts across country have implemented it. #cps
